pullsbody:
I have rebased the second commit from #61 on master. I think it is worth to merge this one to ensure scripts using jQuery are loaded after it. Currently it can happen in wrong order resulting in comments check or social share button not working.

pullsbody: Discourse comments use their own template that doesn't quite mesh with the theme's custom template. This change updates the theme to play well with Discourse comments and also simplifies post headers (which will also pay off when I add support for co-authors in a separate commit).
pull_repo_desc: A universal WordPress theme for Mozilla blogs

pullsbody:
See:
- Media types: https://drafts.csswg.org/mediaqueries/#media-types
- header element: http://www.w3.org/html/wg/drafts/html/CR/sections.html#the-header-element
- nav+ul element: http://www.w3.org/html/wg/drafts/html/CR/sections.html#the-nav-element, http://www.w3.org/html/wg/drafts/html/CR/grouping-content.html#the-ul-element
- footer element: http://www.w3.org/html/wg/drafts/html/CR/sections.html#the-footer-element

pullsbody: Filter shortcodes in `fc_meta_desc()`, so their output is shown in instead of the shortcode itself. You can see the current result without shortcode filtered e.g. in [Google results for mozilla.cz](https://www.google.cz/search?q=mozilla.cz&ie=utf-8&oe=utf-8) (under _Stáhnout Firefox_ headline).

pulltitle: no background-color for img in obsidian
pullsbody:
The background-color for images in entry-content in obsidian causes some ugliness when there's transparency...see here with the async logo: https://bugzilla.mofostaging.net/paid-support/

Also, the border color doesn't really do much of anything, given that there's no border size, so you might want to consider getting rid of that too.

Thanks!

pull_commit_message: no background-color for img in obsidian

pullsbody:
@pascalchevrel can you review this, if you have time?

Many of the changed files show the _entire_ file changing in the diff because I converted them to UTF-8 (some were ISO Latin) and Unix line endings (some had Windows line endings). The changes to pay attention to are smaller edits in a handful of files addressing the issues you previously identified.
pull_repo_desc: A universal WordPress theme for Mozilla blogs

pulltitle: Fix to cross-browser author-vcard-gradient & broken comment-box
pullsbody:
Fixes for [Bug 764532](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=764532)

The broken comment-box issue would not be apparent, unless the anchor contains more texts (such as, "2 Comments and 5 Responses"). The fix mostly takes care of that (without being radical to the elements' padding, background image-sprite etc.), unless the text string is incredibly long (which is unlikely).
pull_repo_desc: A universal WordPress theme for Mozilla blogs

pulltitle: Fix to cross-browser author-vcard-gradient & broken comment-box
pullsbody:
Fixes for [Bug 764532](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=764532)

The broken comment-box issue would not be apparent, unless the anchor contains more texts (such as, "2 Comments and 5 Responses"). The fix mostly takes care of that (without being radical to the elements' padding, background image-sprite etc.), unless the text string is incredibly long (which is unlikely).
pull_repo_desc: A universal WordPress theme for Mozilla blogs
